introduction: The following passage is adapted from Political Oratory by Marian K. Diaz (2021).
text: In her speech, the senator presented a compelling argument against policy reform. As a result, many constituents, who ______ originally supported the reform, changed their positions.
question: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English? Consider the tense needed to reflect a shift in stance over time.
explanation: Choice B is correct because had originally supported indicates a past condition that changed after the senatorâ€™s speech. A will have suggests future perfect tense, which is not logical here. C have places the action in the present. D are having is ungrammatical in this context.
